speakers.bio: Sandi Metz, author of Practical Object-Oriented Design in Ruby and 99 Bottles of OOP, believes in simple code and straightforward explanations. She prefers working software, practical solutions and lengthy bicycle trips (not necessarily in that order) and writes, consults, and teaches about object-oriented design.
speakers.name: Sandi Metz
speakers.title: Programmer / Author / Teacher

speakers.bio: Guillaume Marty has been working on the web for 77% of its lifespan. In the last few years he shifted his focus from code to humans. He's passionate about contributing to a healthy, inclusive industry, and the intersection between communities and technology. He was formerly working at Mozilla, and currently at Twitter.
speakers.name: Guillaume Marty
speakers.title: Web lover / JavaScript activist / HTML5 enthusiast

speakers.bio: I combine my 13 years of professional software engineering experience with a passion for leadership and communication skills. My main focus is on how we can be better technical leaders and developers by focusing on learning the skills most of us ignore - communication and leadership skills. Originally from the UK but now based in Australia, I have consulted, performed workshops and developed software for clients across the UK, Australia, New Zealand and the United States. Technology in all its forms is part of my makeup and so I code, speak, write, teach, make, game and listen to all things geek
speakers.name: Andrew Murphy

speakers.bio: Milecia McGregor is a software engineer lost somewhere in the Midwest. She has mostly worked with .NET, Angular, and Azure to build web apps, but she also has a master’s degree in mechanical and aerospace engineering and has published research in machine learning and robotics. In her free time, she spends time with her husband and dogs while learning to play the ukulele and learning Japanese.
speakers.name: Milecia McGregor
speakers.title: Software Engineer

speakers.bio: I’m currently an engineer at Guru, as well as a mentor/instructor for an online code school called Thinkful. I’m also a co-organizer for the VueJS Philly and GitLab Philly meetup groups. I run my own YouTube channel focused on helping break down programming/web dev concepts into simple terms (or at least I try to). I’ll sometimes mess around making music, or exploring new coffee shops (trying to find the best coffee in Philadelphia).
speakers.name: Ryan Heupler
speakers.title: Mentor & Instructor

speakers.bio: Chris has worked at Comcast since 2007 – currently as a Distinguished Engineer. He enjoys building/motivating teams and ramping up new projects using the latest patterns and web primitives. Besides coding in Javascript, he loves spending time with his family and helping out in the community.
speakers.name: Chris Lorenzo
speakers.title: Distinguished Engineer

speakers.bio: Stacey resides in Fort Wayne, Indiana, and has over 20 years of Law Enforcement (LEO) and teaching experience. Law Enforcement experience: Homicide Detective • Gang Unit Specialist Detective • Hostage Negotiator • Crisis Intervention Team (CIT) Officer •S chool Resources Officer (SRO) • Five years as a Special Agent with the DEPARTMENT OF HOMELAND (DHS). Stacey is currently working as a Detective with the Fort Wayne (Indiana) Police Dept., Gang, and Violent Crimes Unit. Teaching experience: Stacey is an Adjunct Professor: • Business Psychology • Psychology •Criminal Profiling •Criminal Behavior •Computer Psychology •Social Media Psychology •Sociology (Group Dynamics). Education: • Bachelor of Science degree; Criminology (Ball State University, 1994). • Master’s degree; Forensic Psychology (Walden University, 2012). • Currently, a Ph.D. Candidate (Forensic Psychology), at Walden University Affiliations/Memberships: • American Psychology Association (APA) •CIT International member #3036 •Golden Key International Honor Society • National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI) • Omega Psi Phi Fraternity Inc. • Psi Chi International Honor Society (Psychology) • Society for Police and Criminal Psychology
speakers.name: Stacey Jenkins, M. Psych
speakers.title: Ph.D. candidate, International KeynoteSpeaker, BehavioralProfiler, MotivationalSpeaker, TeamBuilder, GroupDynamics.

speakers.bio: A third-generation Brazilian raised in the US, Gabi spent her youth immersed in MS-DOS, server rooms, and Geocities Mariah Carey fan page HTML. She transitioned to a development career in 2016 after spending 7 years as a systems administrator and is active in her local tech community. Namely, she’s the Mentor Director for Coding & Cocktails, a Kansas City Women in Technology program, which teaches monthly coding sessions to help women break into the industry. Amongst her other interests are included ashtanga yoga, learning languages, and curating stellar playlists.
speakers.name: Gabi Dombrowski
speakers.title: freelance web developer and no-ego doer

speakers.bio: Peter is an adventurous and passionate CodeSmith at Ordina Netherlands. He likes to travel around the world with his bike. Always seeking for the unexpected and unknown. For his job he tries out the latest techniques and frameworks. He loves to share his experience by speaking at conferences over the World and writing for the Dutch Java magazine and DZone. He believes that you as the front-end developer are the spider in the web to bring the user, the team and the product together.
speakers.name: Peter Eijgermans
speakers.title: CodeSmith

speakers.bio: Chris is a Staff Software Engineer at LinkedIn, based in New York City working on native video. He is an editor and contributor for both The Ember Times and the LinkedIn Engineering Blog.
speakers.name: Chris Ng
speakers.title: Staff Software Engineer

speakers.bio: Co-Founder of Techqueria untermensch Award-losing web developer all opinions expressed are plagiarized Too old for 30 under 30 been to UC Berkeley
speakers.name: David Silva
speakers.title: Co-Founder of Techqueria

speakers.bio:
I’m Kenigbolo Meya Stephen, Full Stack Software Engineer working as the Frontend Engineering Team Lead at BCaster OY. Formerly Arch Conveyer/Community Manage of CodeAfrique(now Reload), a not-for-profit weekend intensive software engineering bootcamp for underrepresented groups in IT based out of Estonia.'
'During my free time I sometimes volunteer as an open source developer for ADSBx, play golf and coach football (soccer as Americans call it). I also have a nick for writing tiny javascript modules on npm to help a few developers out there so they need not rewrite same utilities that we all might need (usually it’s the case that we’re only a handful needing those so there’s really nothing too worry much about).
speakers.name: Kenigbolo Meya Stephen
speakers.title: Frontend Engineering Team Lead

speakers.bio: James Simpson has spent the greater part of his life pushing the web forward by challenging what is possible in a browser. As founder of GoldFire Studios, he has focussed on real-time gaming, high scalability/performance and some of the largest HTML5 canvas games ever built. He is also passionate about open-source as the author of many projects, including the popular howler.js audio library.
speakers.name: James Simpson
speakers.title: Founder

speakers.bio:
Alfredo is a Director of Engineering at Hearst working with technical and non-technical teams to develop tools that abstract best practices and performance enhancements into measurable business goals.

His current interests include creating highly performant and flexible web applications that enable developers to be productive.

Prior to Hearst, Alfredo worked for an ad platform writing low-level JavaScript that catered to strict browser support requirements. Outside of the web, Alfredo is a musician, film enthusiast, and comedy fan.
speakers.name: Alfredo Lopez
speakers.title: Director of Engineering

speakers.bio: Robin is a UI engineer at Taulia, where she focuses on front end development in React. She is passionate about building stunning user interfaces and intuitive user experiences. She successfully transitioned from teaching ESL to kindergarteners in Shanghai to wrangling code and hasn’t looked back since.
speakers.name: Robin Dykema
speakers.title: UI Engineer

speakers.bio: I’m 28 years old from rural VA. I earned a BS in Economics in 2012, and after working at an education analytics startup after college, taught myself development. I started with frontend development but now happily work up and down the stack. I moved to Philadelphia three years ago to pursue a career in technology. I’ve worked at Comcast the past two years. I currently live in South Philly with my friendly cat, Rupert.
speakers.name: Jeffrey Smith
speakers.title: Design Technologist

speakers.bio: Liz Krane is a developer advocate at Sentry and founder of Learn Teach Code, an organization that empowers aspiring developers to lead their own local events to create stronger, more diverse tech communities. She loves finding new ways to combine code with other disciplines like art and music, sharing everything she learns while she tries to learn everything!
speakers.name: Liz Krane
speakers.title: Software Developer

speakers.bio: Ron Dagdag is a Senior Software Engineer with 20 years of experience working on a number of business applications using a diverse set of frameworks and languages. He currently support developers at Crestron Electronics with their IoT, Cloud and Voice AI Assistant development. On the side, Ron Dagdag is an active participant in the community as a Microsoft MVP, speaker, maker and blogger. Ron enjoys building projects with his 2 kids and he is passionate about Augmented Intelligence, studying the convergence of Augmented Reality, Machine Learning and Internet of Things.
speakers.name: Ron Lyle Dagdag
speakers.title: Senior Software Engineer

speakers.bio: Colleen is a free-spirited techie with a passion for Global Engineering. She’s a life-long learner with a passion for connecting with others. She loves Hackathons, Dogs, Coffee, and the Circus. Her passion projects include an online resource platform for LGBT+ individuals living in countries where Homosexuality is illegal, and a Solar Electric Stove startup called Sol Flame. She currently works at the Ifakara Health Institute in Bagamoyo, Tanzania, building technology tools for Malaria Researchers.
speakers.name: Colleen Dunlap
speakers.title: Software Developer

speakers.bio: Fen Slattery is the Accessibility Lead at Clique Studios, where they build beautiful things and work towards a more inclusive digital world. As a web engineer, Fen seamlessly translates the needs of users into digital experiences that minimize barriers to access. As part of their advocacy work, they have spoken across the US to audiences of all skill levels, been featured on many panels about inclusion in the tech industry, and have spread their passion for accessibility in mentorship of web professionals.
speakers.name: Fen Slattery
speakers.title: Lead Accessibility Engineer

speakers.bio: Front-end software engineer for MachineQ. Esports addict with an affliction for playing competitive games with 0 skills. Bootcamp graduate and organizer of Reactadelphia.
speakers.name: Domitrius Clark
speakers.title: Front-end Software Engineer

speakers.bio:
I am a UX Developer at Alley, where I help build headless digital experiences for publishers and nonprofit institutions, including Fortune and Colorado Public Radio. I was a Code for Philly Open Source Mentorship Program fellow and co-created the Interactive Mechanics Mentorship Program for Diversity and Inclusion in Tech.'
'I came to tech later in life, after a 12-year career as a fundraiser for some of Philadelphia’s most prestigious arts organizations. I wrote my first line of code at age 35 and built my first WordPress theme at 37. Outside of tech, I enjoy reading, cooking, and watching classic films.
speakers.name: Christina Deemer
speakers.title: UX Developer

speakers.bio: Viral Parmar is a Serial entrepreneur who runs ComExpo Cyber security company as well as Infinite Defense Foundation a non-profit organization in India. He is a Developer Advocate, Productivity Hacker, Open Source Strategist, Technical Evangelist, Community Liaison, International TechSpeaker, he is a Cyber Security researcher by profession and open source enthusiast working in a field of information security from last three years with the expertise in Cyber Crime Investigation, Public Key Infrastructure, Social Engineering, Web App Penetration Testing, Digital Forensics and Mobile Security. He found sever vulnerability in 150+ well known websites like Intel, your story and solved more than 100 cases of cyber-crime & online frauds. He is famous for his research Cyber Disorder and Who is spying on you. Trained 150,000+ people till now and aware them about privacy and security. Given Seminars and workshops in 150+ Organizations. He is Working with Mozilla foundation from last 2 years as Reps, Mentor in Mozilla Open Leadership Project, Coach(Privacy and Security) in MozSprint 2018, also working with L10N project on Pontoon, Rust and WebVR projects.
speakers.name: Viral Parmar
speakers.title: Cyber Security Researcher

speakers.bio:
Emily graduated from Stevens Institute of Technology in 2015 with her Bachelor’s and Master’s of Science in Computer Science, as well as a Bachelor’s of Arts in Visual Arts and Technology. After graduating, she entered the CORE Technology rotational program at Comcast NBCUniversal, where she worked on three different teams across the organization over the course of two years.'
'After completing the program, she joined Comcast’s Experience Design department as a UX Engineer, where she has been for the last two years. The prototypes Emily and her team develop help to guide production teams on building out final products, allow senior leaders to demo new ideas to executives, and for researchers to conduct user testing sessions will real life customers.'
'While her team specializing in build JavaScript web applications, Emily also has a passion for animation, is a Captain in the Air Force Reserve, and is an amateur aerial circus artist. One day, she might just run away and join the circus.
speakers.name: Emily Rautenberg
speakers.title: UX Engineer

speakers.bio: Diego Hernandez is a front-end developer at IBM and Software Engineering graduate student at DePaul University in Chicago. He is a trained filmmaker, turned self-taught developer and designer. As a creative person, Diego is always looking for ways to stretch his canvas—in this case, web browsers—to create unique web experiences that tell a story. When he’s not coding, you’ll probably find him attempting to rock climb or in the kitchen trying out a new recipe.
speakers.name: Diego Hernandez
speakers.title: Front-end developer

speakers.bio: Nathan Lilly is a UI Engineer at Comcast where he works on the Help and Support website. He has been developing websites since 1998 and recently received his Certified Web Professional in Accessibility certificate from the IAAP. He is an amateur dilettante who is constantly finding new various topics to love: in programming, creativity, the arts, history, philosophy, machine learning, cognitive science, superhero movies, and space westerns.
speakers.name: Nathan Lilly
speakers.title: UI Engineer

speakers.bio: George Mandis has been a freelance, full-stack web developer and consultant at SnapTortoise serving startups, small businesses, professional sports teams and entrepreneurs for over a decade. Recently he spent a year living as a digital nomad, inadvertently cheated while running a marathon in North Korea and ran a coding bootcamp out of Portland, Oregon. He writes frequently on technology, travel and other things at his website.
speakers.name: George Mandis
speakers.title: Full-stack web developer

speakers.bio: Kas (they/them/their) is a developer 🥑 for CloudFlare. They’re also an author of two books about JS Robotics and a Twitch Affiliate streamer for code and hardware. They like serverless and all the discussions it brings, and playing with their 2 cats.
speakers.name: Mx. Kas Perch
speakers.title: Software developer

speakers.bio:
Angel started his career as an US Air Force Space Systems Operations specialist in Cape Canaveral AF Station where he realized his passion for technology and software development. He has extensive experience in the private, public and military sectors and his technical experience includes military/space lift operations, technical writing, software development, SRE/DevOPs engineering. He also has a wealth of experience in defense and federal sectors such as contracting, information systems security and management.

You can usually find him speaking at or organizing local tech meetups and hackathons where he enjoys engaging with developers.

Angel’s passions are positive disruption, learning, teaching, mentoring but most of all inspiring all forms of technologists & building awesome tech communities.
speakers.name: Angel Rivera

speakers.bio:
Born in Chicago, raised in Dayton, I am a midwest boy. With both parents in education, learning was something I was raised to love. Moving to Dayton, I was fortunate enough to come across opportunities I may not have had. One of these opportunities was a position at the University of Dayton Research Institute (UDRI) as a junior developer. I was working at UDRI through college, which ended with my Associates in Applied Sciences at Sinclair College. I currently work as a Web Developer at Crown Equipment.

I am a problem solver. Developing software is one of my outlets for problem-solving. Mainly developing web applications, my preferred language is JavaScript (mainly Angular and Node). I am currently developing an app to help solve the reading problem. The other outlet is entrepreneurship, in which I have launched BluPrint (discoverbluprint.com (shameless plug)), to help solve the issues that young artists are facing today.

Technology is amazing. The capabilities it can bring are immense, and I want to be a part of bringing it to everyone. There are others like myself, who come from marginalized communities, that have a locked door, preventing them from raising themselves up. Tech is the key to that lock.
speakers.name: Ali Abiba
speakers.title: Web Developer

speakers.bio: Fernando Medina Corey currently spends his days making courses to help software engineers, architects, and technology professionals learn the technologies they need to succeed. He has worked with a variety of different technologies in order to develop web applications, manage data pipelines, and architect cloud infrastructure. In addition to his work, he founded and runs the Redmond Python meetup to help folks learn Python. Fernando has also taught and TAed classes on Python, the Command Line, and big data technologies for Python User Groups and Girl Develop It.
speakers.name: Fernando Medina Corey
